TopicTitle: Displaying an image in a window?

Articles.Content:
I used the code example from the wiki but I\'m just getting garbage when I try to render the texture... is that example still valid?

The code that\'s causing the garbage is (I\'ve tried pre-initializing the texture and also recreating the texture every time I draw it but this is the simplest example):

      private Texture2D m_tx = new Texture2D(300, 100);  private void WindowGUI( int idWin )  {    for (int x = 0; x < m_tx.width; ++x)      for (int y = 0; y < m_tx.height; ++y)      {        Color clr = Color.black;        m_tx.SetPixel(x, y, clr);      }    GUILayout.Box(m_tx);  }

And I get the properly sized window but it\'s filled with a static-y looking bitmap... any good tutorials or docs out there? Alternately any tips would be appreciated. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
